4 #include <emsr/fp_type_util.h>
5 #include <emsr/detail/sf_distributions.tcc>

7 namespace emsr

9 
10  /**
11  * @brief Return the gamma propability distribution function.
12  *
13  * The formula for the gamma probability density function is:
14  * @f[
15  * \Gamma(x|\alpha,\beta) = \frac{1}{\beta\Gamma(\alpha)}
16  * (x/\beta)^{\alpha - 1} e^{-x/\beta}
17  * @f]
18  */
19  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
20  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
21  gamma_pdf(Ta alpha, Tb beta, Tp x)
22  {
23  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
24  return emsr::detail::gamma_pdf<type>(alpha, beta, x);
25  }
26 
27  /**
28  * @brief Return the gamma cumulative propability distribution function.
29  *
30  * The formula for the gamma probability density function is:
31  * @f[
32  * \Gamma(x|\alpha,\beta) = \frac{1}{\beta\Gamma(\alpha)}
33  * (x/\beta)^{\alpha - 1} e^{-x/\beta}
34  * @f]
35  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
36  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
37  gamma_p(Ta alpha, Tb beta, Tp x)
38  {
39  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
40  return emsr::detail::gamma_p<type>(alpha, beta, x);
41  }
42  */
43 
44  /**
45  * @brief Return the normal probability density function.
46  *
47  * The formula for the normal probability density function is
48  * @f[
49  * f(x|\mu,\sigma) = \frac{e^{(x-\mu)^2/2\sigma^2}}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}}
50  * @f]
51  */
52  template<typename Tmu, typename Tsig, typename Tp>
53  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>
54  normal_pdf(Tmu mu, Tsig sigma, Tp x)
55  {
56  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>;
57  return emsr::detail::normal_pdf<type>(mu, sigma, x);
58  }
59 
60  /**
61  * @brief Return the normal cumulative probability density function.
62  *
63  * The formula for the normal cumulative probability density function is
64  * @f[
65  * F(x|\mu,\sigma)
66  * = \frac{1}{2}\left[ 1-erf(\frac{x-\mu}{\sqrt{2}\sigma}) \right]
67  * @f]
68  */
69  template<typename Tmu, typename Tsig, typename Tp>
70  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>
71  normal_p(Tmu mu, Tsig sigma, Tp x)
72  {
73  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>;
74  return emsr::detail::normal_p<type>(mu, sigma, x);
75  }
76 
77  /**
78  * @brief Return the lognormal probability density function.
79  *
80  * The formula for the lognormal probability density function is
81  * @f[
82  * f(x|\mu,\sigma) = \frac{e^{(\ln{x}-\mu)^2/2\sigma^2}}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}}
83  * @f]
84  */
85  template<typename Tmu, typename Tsig, typename Tp>
86  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>
87  lognormal_pdf(Tmu mu, Tsig sigma, Tp x)
88  {
89  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>;
90  return emsr::detail::lognormal_pdf<type>(mu, sigma, x);
91  }
92 
93  /**
94  * @brief Return the lognormal cumulative probability density function.
95  *
96  * The formula for the lognormal cumulative probability density function is
97  * @f[
98  * F(x|\mu,\sigma)
99  * = \frac{1}{2}\left[1-erf\left(
100  * \frac{\ln{x}-\mu}{\sqrt{2}\sigma}\right)\right]
101  * @f]
102  */
103  template<typename Tmu, typename Tsig, typename Tp>
104  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>
105  lognormal_p(Tmu mu, Tsig sigma, Tp x)
106  {
107  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tmu, Tsig, Tp>;
108  return emsr::detail::lognormal_p<type>(mu, sigma, x);
109  }
110 
111  /**
112  * @brief Return the exponential probability density function.
113  *
114  * The formula for the exponential probability density function is
115  * @f[
116  * f(x|\lambda) = \lambda e^{-\lambda x} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
117  * @f]
118  */
119  template<typename _Tlam, typename Tp>
120  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, Tp>
121  exponential_pdf(_Tlam lambda, Tp x)
122  {
123  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, Tp>;
124  return emsr::detail::exponential_pdf<type>(lambda, x);
125  }
126 
127  /**
128  * @brief Return the exponential cumulative probability density function.
129  *
130  * The formula for the exponential cumulative probability density function is
131  * @f[
132  * F(x|\lambda) = 1 - e^{-\lambda x} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
133  * @f]
134  */
135  template<typename _Tlam, typename Tp>
136  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, Tp>
137  exponential_p(_Tlam lambda, Tp x)
138  {
139  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<_Tlam, Tp>;
140  return emsr::detail::exponential_p<type>(lambda, x);
141  }
142 
143  /**
144  * @brief Return the Weibull probability density function.
145  *
146  * The formula for the Weibull probability density function is
147  * @f[
148  * f(x | a, b) = \frac{a}{b}
149  * \left(\frac{x}{b} \right)^{a-1}
150  * \exp{-\left(\frac{x}{b}\right)^a}
151  * \mbox{ for } x >= 0
152  * @f]
153  */
154  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
155  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
156  weibull_pdf(Ta a, Tb b, Tp x)
157  {
158  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
159  return emsr::detail::weibull_pdf<type>(a, b, x);
160  }
161 
162  /**
163  * @brief Return the Weibull cumulative probability density function.
164  *
165  * The formula for the Weibull cumulative probability density function is
166  * @f[
167  * F(x|\lambda) = 1 - e^{-(x / b)^a} \mbox{ for } x >= 0
168  * @f]
169  */
170  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
171  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
172  weibull_p(Ta a, Tb b, Tp x)
173  {
174  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
175  return emsr::detail::weibull_p<type>(a, b, x);
176  }
177 
178  /**
179  * @brief Return the complement of the Students T probability function.
180  *
181  * The complement of the students T propability function is:
182  * @f[
183  * A_c(t|\nu) = I_{\frac{\nu}{\nu + t^2}}(\frac{\nu}{2}, \frac{1}{2})
184  * = 1 - A(t|\nu)
185  * @f]
186  *
187  * @param t
188  * @param nu
189  */
190  template<typename _Tt, typename Tp>
191  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
192  student_t_pdf(_Tt t, unsigned int nu)
193  {
194  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
195  return emsr::detail::student_t_pdf<type>(t, nu);
196  }
197 
198  /**
199  * @brief Return the Students T probability function.
200  *
201  * The students T propability function is related to the incomplete beta function:
202  * @f[
203  * A(t|\nu) = 1 - I_{\frac{\nu}{\nu + t^2}}(\frac{\nu}{2}, \frac{1}{2})
204  * @f]
205  * (see ibeta).
206  *
207  * @param t
208  * @param nu
209  */
210  template<typename _Tt, typename Tp>
211  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
212  student_t_p(_Tt t, unsigned int nu)
213  {
214  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
215  return emsr::detail::student_t_p<type>(t, nu);
216  }
217 
218  /**
219  * @brief Return the F-distribution propability function.
220  * This returns the probability that the observed chi-square
221  * for a correct model exceeds the value @f$ \chi^2 @f$.
222  *
223  * The f-distribution propability function is related
224  * to the incomplete beta function:
225  * @f[
226  * P(F|\nu_1, \nu_2) = 1 - I_{\frac{\nu_2}{\nu_2 + \nu_1 F}}
227  * (\frac{\nu_2}{2}, \frac{\nu_1}{2})
228  * = 1 - Q(F|\nu_1, \nu_2)
229  * @f]
230  *
231  * @param F
232  * @param nu1
233  * @param nu2
234  */
235  template<typename Tp>
236  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
237  fisher_f_pdf(Tp F, unsigned int nu1, unsigned int nu2)
238  {
239  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
240  return emsr::detail::fisher_f_pdf<type>(F, nu1, nu2);
241  }
242 
243  /**
244  * @brief Return the F-distribution propability function.
245  * This returns the probability that the observed chi-square for a correct model
246  * exceeds the value @f$ \chi^2 @f$.
247  *
248  * The f-distribution propability function is related to the incomplete beta function:
249  * @f[
250  * Q(F|\nu_1, \nu_2) = I_{\frac{\nu_2}{\nu_2 + \nu_1 F}}
251  * (\frac{\nu_2}{2}, \frac{\nu_1}{2})
252  * @f]
253  *
254  * @param nu1 The number of degrees of freedom of sample 1
255  * @param nu2 The number of degrees of freedom of sample 2
256  * @param F The F statistic
257  */
258  template<typename Tp>
259  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
260  fisher_f_p(Tp F, unsigned int nu1, unsigned int nu2)
261  {
262  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
263  return emsr::detail::fisher_f_p<type>(F, nu1, nu2);
264  }
265 
266  /**
267  * @brief Return the binomial probability mass function.
268  *
269  * The binomial cumulative distribution function is related
270  * to the incomplete beta function:
271  * @f[
272  * f(k|n,p) = \binom{n}{k}p^k(1-p)^{n-k}
273  * @f]
274  *
275  * @param p
276  * @param n
277  * @param k
278  */
279  template<typename Tp>
280  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
281  binomial_pdf(Tp p, unsigned int n, unsigned int k)
282  {
283  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
284  return emsr::detail::binomial_pdf<type>(p, n, k);
285  }
286 
287  /**
288  * @brief Return the binomial cumulative distribution function.
289  *
290  * The binomial cumulative distribution function is related
291  * to the incomplete beta function:
292  * @f[
293  * P(k|n,p) = I_p(k, n-k+1)
294  * @f]
295  *
296  * @param p
297  * @param n
298  * @param k
299  */
300  template<typename Tp>
301  emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>
302  binomial_p(Tp p, unsigned int n, unsigned int k)
303  {
304  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Tp>;
305  return emsr::detail::binomial_p<type>(p, n, k);
306  }
307 
308  /**
309  * @brief Return the logistic probability density function.
310  *
311  * The formula for the logistic probability density function is
312  * @f[
313  * f(x| a, b) = \frac{e^{(x - a)/b}}{b[1 + e^{(x - a)/b}]^2}
314  * @f]
315  * where @f$b > 0@f$.
316  */
317  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
318  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
319  logistic_pdf(Ta a, Tb b, Tp x)
320  {
321  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
322  return emsr::detail::logistic_pdf<type>(a, b, x);
323  }
324 
325  /**
326  * @brief Return the logistic cumulative distribution function.
327  *
328  * The formula for the logistic probability function is
329  * @f[
330  * P(x| a, b) = \frac{e^{(x - a)/b}}{1 + e^{(x - a)/b}}
331  * @f]
332  * where @f$b > 0@f$.
333  */
334  template<typename Ta, typename Tb, typename Tp>
335  inline emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>
336  logistic_p(Ta a, Tb b, Tp x)
337  {
338  using type = emsr::fp_promote_t<Ta, Tb, Tp>;
339  return emsr::detail::logistic_p<type>(a, b, x);
340  }
